text: Activation of transcription by binding of <extra_id_0> NF-E1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> YY1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) to a newly identified element in the first exon of the human <extra_id_0> DR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

text: A previously unrecognized element , located downstream of the start site of transcription in the first exon of the <extra_id_0> DR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , has been defined that enhances promoter activity up to eightfold in a position - dependent manner .

Mutations in this DNA - binding site abolished binding of a nuclear factor in human B cell nuclear extract and decreased the activity of the <extra_id_0> DR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter to a basal level .

Significant sequence homology of this element was found in the DNA of the <extra_id_0> DR beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , DP alpha and -beta , and <extra_id_0> DQ alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes , always located downstream of the transcriptional start site .

The nuclear factor binds to the <extra_id_0> DR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> DP alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> element but not to the element in the <extra_id_0> DQ alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
It was identified as <extra_id_0> NF-E1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> YY1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

This protein , previously identified by its binding to the Ig kappa 3 ' enhancer and the Ig heavy chain mu E1 site , thus also appears to be quite important in the regulation of MHC class II gene expression .
